citeinfo.origin: National Park Service Geologic Resources Evaluation (GRE) program.
citeinfo.title: Area Geologic Hazard Features of Biscayne National Park and Vicinity, Florida (NPS, GRE, BISC, BISCHZA)

citeinfo.origin: National Park Service Geologic Resources Evaluation (GRE) program.
citeinfo.title: Digital Geologic Map of Biscayne National Park

descript.abstract: The Area Geologic Hazard Features of Biscayne National Park and Vicinity, Florida data (BISCHZA) consists of area (polygon) geologic hazard features and the boundaries that define those areas (polygons). The data were completed as a component of the Geologic Resources Evaluation (GRE), a National Park Service (NPS) Inventory and Monitoring (I&M) funded program that is administered by the NPS Geologic Resources Division (GRD). The spatial data (coverage/theme) was produced from digital data provided by the Florida Geological Survey. The coverage/theme (BISCHZA/BISCHZAA) was attributed as per the NPS GIS-Geology Data Model. An indexed ArcInfo .E00 (export) coverage file and an ArcView 3.X .SHP theme were then also created. The coverage/theme is within the area of interest of Biscayne National Park. The coverage/theme is in NAD83, UTM Zone 17N.
descript.purpose: Data intended to assist NPS personnel in the protection and management of Biscayne National Park.
descript.supplinf: The Area Geologic Hazard Features of Biscayne National Park and Vicinity, Florida coverage/theme (BISCHZA/BISCHZAA) is a component of the Digital Geologic Map of Biscayne National Park. Other coverages/themes that comprise the Digital Geologic Map of Biscayne National Park include: BISCGLG (area geologic units and contacts), BISCSUR (surficial geologic units and contacts), BISCBEN (benthic habitat units and contacts), BISCMIN (mine and mine related point features) and BISCSEC (geologic cross section lines). Two accessory data tables, BISCGLG1 (accessory geologic unit data) and BISCMAP (source map information), are also considered map components.

idinfo.useconst: Not for use at scale greater than 1:24,000 (source map scale).
idinfo.datacred: Heather Stanton and Anne R. Poole

attracc.attraccr: Attribution was derived and checked by visual comparison of data with a copy of the unpublished FGS digital data. Users of this data are advised to FULLY and CAREFULLY READ the "DISTRIBUTION LIABILITY" section of this metadata before using the data.

dataqual.complete: Data is considered complete to the extent of the unpublished FGS digital data.

horizpa.horizpar: Data is assumed to meet National Map Accuracy Standards. The PRECISION of the ArcInfo coverage .E00/ArcView .SHP theme file is DOUBLE.

citeinfo.origin: Arthur, J.D., Baker, A.E., Cichon, J.R., Wood, A.R., and Rudin, A.
citeinfo.title: Florida Aquifer Vulnerability Assessment (FAVA): Contamination potential of Florida's principal aquifer systems
citeinfo.othercit: Arthur, J.D., Baker, A.E., Cichon, J.R., Wood, A.R., and Rudin, A., 2005, Florida Aquifer Vulnerability Assessment (FAVA): Contamination potential of Florida's principal aquifer systems, Florida Geological Survey, 1:24,000 scale

srcinfo.srccitea: unpublished FGS digital data (Arthur, J.D., Baker, A.E., Cichon, J.R., Wood, A.R., and Rudin, A., 2005, Florida Aquifer Vulnerability Assessment (FAVA): Contamination potential of Florida's principal aquifer systems, Florida Geological Survey, 1:24,000 scale)
srcinfo.srccontr: All area geologic hazard features and their boundary arcs were produced from inherited data produced by the Florida Geological Survey. The provided digital data was used to attribute features, as per the NPS GIS-Geology Data Model.

procstep.procdesc: Area geologic hazard features and their boundary arcs were produced from inherited data produced by the Florida Geological Survey. Data features were converted to an ArcGIS geodatabase feature class (BISCHZA) and clipped to the Biscayne National Park area of interest (ArcToolbox Clip tool). Topology between the features and their boundary arcs was then created. Data Model attribution was derived from inherited attribution. The data were 're-projected'into NAD83, UTM Zone 17N and exported to a coverage. An indexed (ArcInfo INDEX command) ArcInfo .E00 (export) coverage file and an ArcView 3.X .SHP theme were then created.

distinfo.resdesc: BISCGRE.ZIP (ArcInfo coverages) or BISCGRS.ZIP (ArcView .SHP theme files)
distinfo.distliab:
The National Park Service shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. These data and related graphics are not legal documents and are not intended to be used as such.
The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the original sources from which they were derived. It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and consistent within the limitations of geospatial data in general and these data in particular. The related graphics are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not appropriate to use the related graphics as data.
The National Park Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from an NPS server and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the National Park Service, no warranty, expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on another system or for general scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies to both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data.
